resource.chars:
<u>Explanation of the Figures <\u> Pl. I. II. III.
Pl. I. Salpa.
fig. 1. Salpa A.
fig.2. Salpa B.
fig.3. Dorsal view of S.A. the muscular bands being striated 
fig.4. Dorsal view of S.B. the muscular bands being annulled [?]
fig.5. Intestinal canal of S.A.
fig.6. Do. Do. of B.
fig.7. Dorsal view of extremity of Salpa B.
fig.8. Part of the respiratory chamber of S.B. shewing 
the foetus suspended - View from above 
fig.9. Connexion of the gemmiferous tube with the 
heart -
Pl. II. Salpa -
fig.1. Young gemmae (Salpa B) attached to the gemmiferous 
tube 
”2. Nuclear end of one of these shewing the ovum 
and its pedicle or gubernaculum -
“3. Nuclear end of a very young Salpa A. just 
detached 
“3a - Placenta & gemmiferous tube of this enlarged 
“4. Heart, Placenta and gemmiferous tube 
of a young Salpa A. shewing the rudimentary 
condition of the last structure 
“5. Ganglion otolithic sac & languet -
“6. Young salpa A. still attached by its 
placenta in the interior of Salpa B -
